Comment: I've been experimenting with a universal b6 defense.  This is the first time that I faced f4.
I've been experimenting with a universal b6 defense.  This is the first time that I faced f4.
This, I thought, was unusual.  b6 tries to control the light squares with the B and d4 just creates a light-square hole on e4.

This surprised me.  While Ng5 does go after Black's weakness on e3, I would have thought more preparation was needed, like Rc1, b4, c5 etc.
I'm not sure of White's intention here.  Even without Be2, Ng4 can be met easily.  Maybe Bf3 was the eventual intent?
